intro: Coccoloba excelsa var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate various soil conditions.
